oai_dc:dc.dc:title: DENSIFICATION AND HIGH CRITICAL-CURRENT DENSITIES IN BULK YBA2CU3O7-Y SUPERCONDUCTOR BY THE SOLID-STATE REACTION TECHNIQUE
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: RAM, P
SAXENA, VR
RAMAMOHAN, TR
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: y-ba-cu
high-tc superconductors
thin-films
o superconductors
high-jc
a-axis
fabrication
growth
oxide
transport
superconductivity
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Bulk samples of YBa2Cu3O7-y prepared by the solid state reaction method exhibited high density (96%) and high J(c) (2586 A cm(-2)) values at 77 K and zero magnetic field. The effect of extended heat treatments on the density and oxygen content of the samples is discussed in connection with microstructure and changes observed in J(c), T-c and transition width Delta T-c.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: MATERIALS SCIENCE AND ENGINEERING B-SOLID STATE MATERIALS FOR ADVANCED TECHNOLOGY, 34(2-3), 106-111
